intro: Lycaste panamanensis, commonly known as the Panama lycaste, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central America. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its pseudobulbs and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces intricate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with a yellow lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
